Posts.Content: Hi, This is my first post. So many questions!!!! I had a bilateral mastectomy on 27th August with immediate reconstruction with implants. The swelling though is not improving, also I cant lie down as then it affects my breathing (it hurts, and restricts breath) I know its early days but a sleep would be good. Does anyone have any tips for me?? I did ask about the pain when I was at the clinic and they said sounds like I have maybe pulled a muscle after op too!!! I cant help but worry that the cancer is also in my lungs, or ribs - does anyone else have experience of any of these issues. Any insight greatly appreciated. Also I will start chemo in 2 - 3 weeks and get my nhs voucher for a wig next week !!! Cancer was also in 1 lymph node - they removed 6 to test so radiation is on the list too for later.
Posts.Title: Anyone else had mastectomy with reconstruction?

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne,Thanks for the reassurance it sounds like you have had similar experience, which is reassuring. Its hard to stay positive all the time. :) Also I have never used a forum before..... isn't this whole experience so full of firsts!!!! ... Elaine xxx
Posts.Title: Anyone else had mastectomy with reconstruction?

Posts.Content: Thanks to Vanda & Helen, I too bought the V cushion to help the sleep sitting up. I think I maybe need them to up pain relief, I only have paracetamol and dicloflex. Tramadol made me sick when in hospital. I dont think it is unusual to have reconstruction with chemo - well nobody mentioned anything when it was being discussed pre op!!!! At that time though they did not expect me to be getting radiotherapy too. I think I am an impatient sort so I expected things to be improving after op..... the fluid build up is getting a bit bad also I have redness on the right side which is spreading, though to me it doesnt feel hotter than the left - its weird when the skin is numb!!! Back to hospital tomorrow anyway to meet with haematologist to discuss chemo. Thanks again, Elaine xxx
